page.title: 08ART AND CRAFT IN HORSHAM
page.content: In Horsham a wide range of crafts can be found. Many people do craft for fun. The opportunity exists to belong to clubs and societies, or attending day/night classes at Forest Boys Community Centre. There are adult education courses for a variety of crafts. Most popular are violin making, spinning, weaving and dyeing. Twelve people are needed in order to run one of these classes. Women attend more often than men. Horsham also has a school of art, dating from 1881, now located in Hurst road. It offers two full time courses for students from the North Sussex area. The newly opened Arts centre often displays work received from artists both in and ot of the area. Horsham District Council makes frequent provision for craft fayres to be held in the old Town Hall.
